pullRequest.title: Add Jakarata JAX-B 3.0
pullRequest.bodyText:
Re-does reverted change and renames jaxb feature to follow naming convention
Fixes #12407

nodes.bodyText: This doesn't make sense.  Why is this feature called jakartaMail-1.6?  Why isn't it called 2.0?  The feature name should be io.openliberty.jakarta.activation.2.0.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -6,6 +6,6 @@ IBM-ShortName: jakartaaMail-1.6
 Subsystem-Version: 1.6
 Subsystem-Name: JakartaMail 1.6
 -bundles=\
-  com.ibm.websphere.jakarta.activation.2.0; location:="dev/api/spec/,lib/";mavenCoordinates="jakarta.activation:jakarta.activation-api:2.0"
+  io.openliberty.activation.2.0; location:="dev/api/spec/,lib/";mavenCoordinates="jakarta.activation:jakarta.activation-api:2.0"

nodes.bodyText: Should this feature depend on the activation bundle or the activation feature?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=io.openliberty.jakarta.jaxb-3.0
+visibility=private
+singleton=true
+IBM-App-ForceRestart: uninstall, \
+ install
+IBM-Process-Types: client, \
+ server
+Subsystem-Name: Jakarta XML Bindings 3.0
+-features=\
+  com.ibm.websphere.appserver.classloading-1.0
+-bundles=\
+  io.openliberty.jakarta.activation.2.0;  location:="dev/api/spec/,lib/"; mavenCoordinates="jakarta.activation:jakarta.activation-api:2.0.0-RC3", \

nodes.bodyText: This feature should have a dependency on the eeCompatible-9.0 feature.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,30 @@
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=io.openliberty.jaxb-3.0
+visibility=public
+singleton=true
+IBM-App-ForceRestart: uninstall, \
+ install
+IBM-API-Package: \
+  jakarta.activation; type="spec", \
+  jakarta.xml.bind;  type="spec", \
+  jakarta.xml.bind.annotation;  type="spec", \
+  jakarta.xml.bind.annotation.adapters;  type="spec", \
+  jakarta.xml.bind.attachment;  type="spec", \
+  jakarta.xml.bind.helpers;  type="spec", \
+  jakarta.xml.bind.util;  type="spec"
+IBM-ShortName: jaxb-3.0
+IBM-Process-Types: client, \
+ server
+Subsystem-Name: Jakarta XML Bindings 3.0
+-features=\
+  com.ibm.websphere.appserver.classloading-1.0, \
+  io.openliberty.jakarta.jaxb-3.0

+

+ io.openlibert.jakarta.jaxb.3.0; version="[1,1.0.100)"; location="dev/api/spec/", \ \

nodes.bodyText: I thought this happened automatically with the EE9Actiion.
Shouldn't the deletion of the com.ibm.websphere.jakarta.activation.2.0 component be part of this PR?
This should be io.openliberty not io.open
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=io.openliberty.jakarta.jaxb-3.0
+visibility=private
+singleton=true
+IBM-App-ForceRestart: uninstall, \
+ install
+IBM-Process-Types: client, \
+ server
+Subsystem-Name: Jakarta XML Bindings 3.0
+-features=\
+  com.ibm.websphere.appserver.classloading-1.0, \
+  io.openliberty.jakarta.activation-2.0
+-bundles=\
+  io.openliberty.jakarta.jaxb.3.0; location:="dev/api/spec/,lib/"; mavenCoordinates="jakarta.xml.bind:jakarta.xml.bind-api:3.0.0-RC3", \
+  io.open.jaxb.3.0.internal.tools

commit.message: rename old com.ibm.ws packages to new io.openliberty

afterCommit.message: rename old com.ibm.ws packages to new io.openliberty

nodes.bodyText: Having this extra space is bad
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -35,7 +35,7 @@ Import-Package: \
   jakarta.xml.bind.*; version="[3.0,4.0]", \
   com.sun.xml.tools.*, \
   com.ibm.wsspi.classloading, \
-  org.apache.xml.*; resolution:=optional, \
+  org.apache.xml.*; resolution:=optional, \

nodes.bodyText: You changed the name here, but you did not change the file directory structure in the resources directory.
The CMVCPATHNAME should change for all of these.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,25 @@
+###############################################################################
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+###############################################################################
+
+# NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_ALL
+#
+#CMVCPATHNAME com.ibm.ws.jaxws.ejb/resources/com/ibm/ws/jaxb/tools/internal/resources/JaxbToolsMessages.nlsprops

nodes.bodyText: I guess I am still struggling with how ws-schemagen.jakarta.jar and ws-xjc.jakarta.jar get created.  Also how there is a Java EE version and a Jakarta EE version.  How does the scripts know which one to use.  Didn't see any script stuff.  So part of why I am so confused.  Some of it has to do with I don't understand how the bnd files in io.openliberty.jaxb.3.0.internal.tools are used.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,33 @@
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=io.openliberty.jaxb-3.0
+visibility=public
+singleton=true
+IBM-App-ForceRestart: uninstall, \
+ install
+IBM-API-Package: \
+  jakarta.activation; type="spec", \
+  jakarta.xml.bind;  type="spec", \
+  jakarta.xml.bind.annotation;  type="spec", \
+  jakarta.xml.bind.annotation.adapters;  type="spec", \
+  jakarta.xml.bind.attachment;  type="spec", \
+  jakarta.xml.bind.helpers;  type="spec", \
+  jakarta.xml.bind.util;  type="spec"
+IBM-ShortName: jaxb-3.0
+IBM-Process-Types: client, \
+ server
+Subsystem-Name: Jakarta XML Bindings 3.0
+-features=\
+  com.ibm.websphere.appserver.classloading-1.0, \
+  com.ibm.websphere.appserver.eeCompatible-9.0, \
+  io.openliberty.jakarta.jaxb-3.0
+-bundles=\
+  io.openliberty.jaxb.3.0.internal.tools
+-files=\
+  bin/jaxb/xjc.bat, \
+  bin/jaxb/tools/ws-schemagen.jakarta.jar, \

commit.message: Update feature to remove external files for now
Update bundle due to import failures in PB
